title: Teen entrepreneurs’ top business tips
description: Two young businessmen who started their ventures when they were at school share their advice on how to sustain your business during the pandemic.

title: Recovering from Covid-19 in India: 'I can't get the images out of my head'
description: Many patients are at the risk of suffering from PTSD, but India lacks infrastructure to treat them.

title: US election 2020: What is Trump's record on the environment?
description: The president has dismissed the science on climate change. But what is his record on the environment?

title: Coronavirus: How we faced redundancy in lockdown
description: Young people are losing more jobs than any other age group - Newsbeat has been speaking to some of them.

title: Violence and hostility: Inside the French police
description: French journalist Valentin Gendrot describes the two years he spent undercover as a French police officer.

title: Full circuit: Round-Britain photographer Quintin Lake's epic journey
description: Photographer Quintin Lake completes his walk, five years and 10,000km on.

title: US wildfires: What are the health risks of smoke pollution?
description: A look at the impact of wildfire smoke, as it increasingly becomes a source of air pollution.

title: West Coast fires: How we outran a California wildfire
description: Trapped by a fast-moving wildfire, four friends were forced to hike their way to safety.

title: Kim Kardashian West joins Facebook and Instagram boycott
description: Dozens of celebrities announce they will freeze their accounts to protest against hate speech.

title: Duke and duchess make bagels in surprise visit
description: Bakery staff tell the royals how the coronavirus pandemic has affected the business and their lives.

title: Battle of Britain: Sky tribute to The Few near Duxford air base
description: Display pilots mark the 80th anniversary of the air battle with a special message written in the sky.

title: Coronavirus: Testing problems leaving families in limbo
description: Parents are missing work and children kept home from school as they wrestle with the testing system

title: Booker Prize 2020: Four debuts make shortlist as Hilary Mantel misses out
description: Four debut novels are on the Booker Prize shortlist, but two-time winner Hilary Mantel misses out.

title: BBC star salaries: Gary Lineker takes pay cut as Zoe Ball shoots up list
description: The Match of the Day host may earn less than Radio 2's Zoe Ball, whose pay has shot up by £1m.

title: Coronavirus: Testing issues 'will be solved in a matter of weeks', says Hancock
description: Health Secretary Matt Hancock tells MPs there has been a "sharp rise" in those seeking a test.

title: Charlie Elphicke: Ex-MP jailed for sex assaults on women
description: Charlie Elphicke, the ex-Tory MP for Dover, was convicted of sexually assaulting two women.

title: Alexei Navalny: Poisoned Putin critic 'will return to Russia'
description: The opposition figure posted on Instagram, announcing that he was breathing free of ventilation.

title: US West Coast fires: Is Trump right to blame forest management?
description: Is poor management of forests to blame for deadly fires in the United States?

title: School figures show 88% of pupils were back for start of term
description: Most parents sent their children back to school but now problems with Covid tests threaten attendance.

title: Coronavirus: I got a job after 280 rejections
description: After being made redundant in lockdown, Hannah tells Radio 1 Newsbeat about her job hunting journey

title: Women lose state pension age appeal against government
description: Two women hit by changes to the state pension age and backed by campaign group BackTo60 lose their appeal.

title: Small firms thrown lifeline in insurance test case ruling
description: The High Court has ruled some insurers should have paid out for losses caused by lockdown.

title: Young people hit as unemployment rate rises
description: The unemployment rate increases to 4.1% from 3.9%, its highest level for two years.

title: Coronavirus: Sir Keir Starmer calls for furlough scheme replacement
description: The Labour leader also warns of the "scarring effect" of "mass unemployment" on communities.

title: Grealish signs new five-year deal with Aston Villa
description: "It is my club, my home," says England midfielder Jack Grealish as he signs a new five-year deal with Aston Villa.

title: Gary Lineker: Match of the Day presenter signs new BBC deal
description: Match of the Day presenter Gary Lineker signs a new contract that will keep him at the BBC until 2025.

title: Tennessee Titans kicker Stephen Gostkowski misses four times then hits game-winner
description: Tennessee Titans kicker Stephen Gostkowski misses four kicks at goal during his team's match against the Denver Broncos but hits the game-winner for a 16-14 victory.

title: Hamilton says he 'won't let up' on protests as FIA rules out T-shirt investigation
description: Lewis Hamilton says he "won't let up" in his fight against injustice as the FIA decides not to investigate his actions at the Tuscan Grand Prix.

title: Essex lorry deaths: Four people jailed in Vietnam
description: The defendants were paid $22,000 by one victim for the illegal journey to Britain, state media report.

title: 'I've applied for 100 jobs and not got an interview'
description: People looking for work during the coronavirus pandemic tell BBC Scotland about their experiences.

title: Coronavirus: Why it could be a 'lonely time' for Jewish families
description: From Friday, the Jewish faith will enter its most holy period, marking Rosh Hashanah and Yom Kippur.

title: ECB to cut 62 jobs amid losses of more than £100m because of Covid-19
description: The England and Wales Cricket Board is to cut 62 jobs as a result of the impact of the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Ocado says M&S switchover 'successful' after rocky start
description: Despite cancelled orders, the online grocer says its move to delivering M&S goods is going well.

title: Hong Kong's dolphins make pandemic comeback
description: Travel restrictions have cut down maritime travel, bringing vulnerable dolphins back to the waters around Hong Kong.

title: Housing crisis: The 59-year-old woman who lives in a van
description: Official figures undercount the real numbers waiting for social housing by 500,000, a study claims.
